adjectives.description: invalid (comparative more invalid, superlative most invalid)

entries.meaning: Not valid; not true, correct, acceptable or appropriate.
examples: Your argument is invalid because it uses circular reasoning.
This invalid contract cannot be legally enforced.

description: From Middle French invalide, from Latin invalidus (“infirm, weak”), from in- (“not”) + validus (“strong”).

entries.meaning: Intended for use by an invalid.
(dated, sometimes offensive) Any person with a disability or illness.
(dated, sometimes offensive) A person who is confined to home or bed because of illness, disability or injury; one who is too sick or weak to care for themselves.
(archaic) A disabled member of the armed forces; one unfit for active duty due to injury.

verbs.description: invalid (third-person singular simple present invalids, present participle invaliding, simple past and past participle invalided)

entries.meaning: (Britain, transitive) To exempt from (often military) duty because of injury or ill health.
examples: He was invalided home after the car crash.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make invalid or affect with disease.
